name: Holiday Inn Express Hotel & Suites Florence I-95 @ Hwy 327

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Everything was more than satisfactory at this location, a bit away from the main area of Florence but quiet and only a few minutes from our favorite restaurant, Fatz. But when we left and were more than two hours from the hotel, my husband realized he had left his wallet on the night table. We phoned the hotel and spoke to Amanda. She said the wallet had already been turned in by the housekeeper, Dominique, and Amanda would send the wallet to our home via Fed Ex. We are eternally grateful to the hotel and its staff.
reviews.title: Honesty is their policy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As expected at these facilities everything was very clean, the staff was especially nice and helpful and the breakfast was good. Some hotels offer thawed pastries in plastic wrappers and off brand juices as breakfast. This is far and above that. The neatest thing the HIExpresses have now is an automatic pancake maker. It was fantastic and so were the pancakes! The breakfast staff was so nice and friendly as well. Would definitely stay at this facility again.
reviews.title: Lovely

reviews.text: I am usually impressed by this chain, but this particular hotel needs some attention. While the bed was comfortable, the sheets were extremely worn. The air conditioner in the room was very loud, making sleeping difficult. It still had the same complimentary hot breakfast, no issues here. Still with some easy fixes, this is a good hotel for a short stay.
reviews.title: Not Up to Par

reviews.text: Professional front desk clerks! I thought i lost my coffee mug there (which i didn't), so I called and they genuinely cared about my situation. I really appreciate that. The rooms were very clean and comfortable. The breakfast was good when comparing to other free hotel breakfasts. They had hot items and many choices for drink.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.text: I like the Holiday Inn Express chain. The hotels are new, the prices are reasonable and the quality is consistently good.
reviews.title: Shocked by Lack of Management Response

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When we were planning this road trip we were bringing my 10 year old cousin with us. We knew that, with all of the stops we wanted to make, we would be spending very little time in hotel rooms. With all of that in mind we booked more family friendly, economical, and roomier hotel rooms.
reviews.title: Acceptable Hotel

reviews.text: The Holiday Inn Express feels like a newer hotel on the outside and inside. Our check in was average and we were given a room on the 3rd floor. The elevators at the hotel are very slow with the one on the right hand side being the slowest.
reviews.title: Scammed by cancellation policy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We walked into our room and could only turn on one light. As we fumbled around in the dark we realized all the other lights were unplugged. After finding the wall plugs, we had light in the room. Our room was a 2 queen bed, with tv, fridge, table, coffee maker, and large bathroom. The downside to this room was the bathroom wasn't very clean. The toilet seat wasn't washed properly and there was hair left in the shower. Knowing that it was late and there wouldn't be any maid staff at the hotel we just cleaned it ourselves.
reviews.title: Beware the elevator

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was included in our rate so the next morning we headed downstairs before leaving. The hotel offers coffee, orange juice, passionfruit juice, eggs, sausages, biscuits and gravy, breads, pancakes, and delicious cinnamon rolls. Breakfast was good except, although the fact people don't have consideration for others made is difficult to enjoy. One family allowed their kids to cough and sneeze all over the place without covering their mouths, another family kept switching tables, and yet another family had a daughter whohad some food out of her mouth while she was eating and then proceeded to leave it on the table. Yuck!
reviews.title: Good hotel stop on way to Florida

reviews.text: Overall the hotel was acceptable.
reviews.title: Just what you need on a drive along I-95!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at this HIE for one night to attend a wedding. The hotel is fine for a one-night stay. The room was small, but not tiny. It did have an easy chair, but no accompanying hassock. It also had a desk, chair, small microwave and refrigerator. It looked as though the carpet was new, and the room was quite clean. The bathroom was also quite clean--small, but again, not tiny. The breakfast--which is a part of the rate--is nice to have. It consisted of pre-made omelets, really good (warm) cinnamon rolls, a pancake machine --which was not working--, and the usual bagels, toast, cereals, juices, etc.
reviews.title: Average stay

reviews.text: The room felt a bit damp during the night, but the only real problem (room 302) was the really squeaky bed. The bed was comfortable, but the squeaks every time one of us turn over was annoying.
reviews.title: Ahhh! Such a nice stay!

reviews.text: Since this was the hotel reserved for the wedding guests, we were afraid there might be noise. In fact, when we arrived about 5:00 P.M., there was a party going on in a room a few doors down from us, which made us really skeptical about what kind of night's sleep we were going to get. However, once we got into our room, we couldn't hear the party, and we heard no noise at all during the night--not even doors closing--a real plus!
reviews.title: Easy access off of 95

reviews.text: We were happy with this average hotel for our one-night stay.
reviews.title: Road trip

reviews.text: Checked in later and we didn't have to wait, someone was there at the counter. Not like some places where they run off after a certain time.
reviews.title: Family trip

reviews.text: Had a great stay at this Holiday Inn Express! The Hotel was very clean and right off I-95. The staff was very friendly and helpful! The room was very large, double queen beds, with comfortable matresses and pillows. The included breakfast was a nice surprise, biscuits and gravy, pancakes, eggs, sausage, all kind of breads, yogurts, hard boiled eggs, cereal, very good coffee. Big savings with a traveling family. This the only hotel off I-95’s Exit 170, so the previous post must have confused the actual location of their stay. I would stay here again and recommend this great find! You will not be disappointed!
reviews.title: Great Room! Friendly Staff! Would Stay Again!

reviews.text: excellent customer service, what a wonderful staff member Sandra was !!! we will stay here anytime we pass that way again. clean cheap and cozy the 3 C's strike again !!!
reviews.title: what a gem

reviews.text: This was a nice hotel and friendly staff. My only complaint was that I tried twice to contact the front desk and no one ever answered the phone. When I walked out there was no one there. We were needing assistance in the breakfast area and still could not find anyone to help. Room was priced a little high for the area
reviews.title: Nice place to stay right off the Interstate

reviews.text: I have stayed in this hotel multiple times. Once I stayed almost week and had a very pleasant experience. On June 16th I arrived at approx. 6 pm and requested one of their rooms that had a jet tube due to back problem I have. I didn't try to get a reduction on the price of $139.00 per night. I told them I had to go a visit some people and would return in a few hours.
reviews.title: This WAS my favorite hotel until my last visit

reviews.text: Upon my arrival I headed streight to the tub to run a bath. I found PUBIC hairs in the tub, and the filter was brown. Needless to say NO MUCH NEED BATH FOR ME. I had driven 10+ hours from Cape Coral Fl. I was so tired I rinsed the tub took a quick shower and redressed and went to the front desk where I was treated fairly with a fifty dollar reduction and an offer to move me to another room. I was to tired for that so I retired for the evening.
reviews.title: More emphasis on greed than customer service

aka: Holiday Inn Express Hotel And Suites Florence i-95 @ Hwy 327
description: Welcome to the Holiday Inn Express Hotel & Suites Florence South Carolina.This premiere hotel is superbly located in the suburbs of Florence, SC, away from the hustle and bustle for a great night sleep but just minutes to Florence Regional Airport, area businesses, restaurants, attractions and shopping.A Great Business Location! The Holiday Inn Express Hotel & Suites is well located to fine companies such as Peterbilt, DuPont, Smurfit-Stone Container, Crenlo, H. J. Heinz, Beneteau, FedEx, Roche Carolina, NuCor Steel, Koppers Industries, ABB, Maytag, IFH, Iron Mountain, Wellmans, Pee Dee Electric Cooperative, SteelFab, Johnson Controls, Pepsi, Blanchard Machinery and many others. The hotel offers the select services a business traveler needs for a productive visit. Our four-story, interior corridor hotel boasts 86 guest rooms & suites. Attention to detail provides the warmth and comfort of personalized service . . . for every guest, time after time. Packed with amenities! We offer the amenities and services needed to make your stay productive and enjoyable such as our heated indoor pool, complimentary 24 hr. business center with high speed Internet access, guest laundry, on-site fitness center, and meeting facilities but our finest attribute is our friendly staff. We look forward to serving you.
